result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A. Gordon

defendant.name: Gordon, Michael A.
defendant.address: 1160 3rd Ave South Apt. 11C, Park Falls, WI 54552

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on January 12, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

10:16 AM Defendant Michael A. Gordon appeared by video, in custody from the Ashland County Jail.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer appeared by phone for Michael A. Gordon.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Restemayer gives updates and states he is not sure why the defendant is in custody as the Price County warrant was quashed. Defendant gives responses and states he is in Ashland County on a separate incident. Court reiterates that the warrant is quashed through Price County and the original bond and its conditions are reinstated. Motion hearing for Miranda Goodchild set for 01/12/2023 at 2PM
See notes from 9/20/22,   2 certified copies returned from PRSO

10:39 AM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant does not appear. Attorney Restemayer appeared in person for the defendant. Karl J. Kelz appeared for The State of Wisconsin. Attorney Restemayer States there was a bench warrant ordered for $500 however the warrant issued and signed was $1,000. Attorney Restemayer requests the bond be re-issued, corrected, and held until his appearance on 9/27/22 as a rescheduled hearing. No objection by the State. The court will adopt the request by Attorney Restemayer. Court will Quash the $1,000 warrant and re-issue in the amount of $500 plus the warrant fee and be held until 9/27/22. So ordered.
Return on warrant on September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:03 AM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Michael A. Gordon not in court.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer appeared by video for Michael A. Gordon.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Restemayer gives status updates in the case and states he has had no communication with his client as to his non-appearance. Court goes over the record and states the notice for today's hearing did not come back undeliverable. Attorney Restemayer requests this matter be set for a Motion hearing. DA Kelz requests the court wait to set a Motion Hearing until contact has been made with the defendant. DA Kelz motions for a bench warrant in the amount of $500. So ordered plus warrant fee.
Status hearing on September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Notice of right to attorney given to DE. If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
